Also, I am not able to delete the Launch Configuration. Pressing delete in the 
editor does nothing. Trying to change its state from shared to local just 
*creates a new* local configuration. Deleting the .launch file doesn't help 
either - the configuration still appears in the editor and a new .launch file 
is created on running it.

Just observed that deleting a shared config (or changing it to local) correctly 
deletes the .launch file, it's just not reflected in the GUI until a complete 
restart of Eclipse.

I have been unable to reproduce this problem. Do you have a simple 
reproduceable test case or a simple workspace that you could zip/attach to show 
us the problem?

I am unable to reproduce this in a fresh workspace, so it is only happening in 
my production workspace - which is rather BIG...

Are there any files you are especially interested in?

Look for any files in  your workspace with ".launch" - export them somewhere 
and then delete them. Also all files in 
your ".metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.debug.core/.launches/" directory - copy 
them somewhere, and then delete them. This should clean your workspace of 
corrupt launch files.

OK, know that I have deleted the files you mentioned, it seems to work. Thank 
you very much!
